name: Bed-Stuy DIY Spot
description: Community-built DIY spot under the J/M tracks. Raw, creative, and constantly evolving.
history: Started as a few poured ledges in an empty lot. The Bed-Stuy skate community has built it into a full-featured spot over several years.
bestTimes: Weekday evenings. Weekend afternoon sessions often have BBQs.
transitDirections: J/M to Myrtle-Broadway, walk south on Broadway.

detailedNotes.terrain: Features include DIY quarter pipe, bank, flat bar, manual pad, jersey barriers. Raw concrete and found materials — expect imperfections.
detailedNotes.culture: Part of the Brooklyn skate scene in Bedford-Stuyvesant. Started as a few poured ledges in an empty lot. The Bed-Stuy skate community has built it into a full-featured spot over several years.
detailedNotes.tips: Best approach: J/M to Myrtle-Broadway, walk south on Broadway.. Weekday evenings. Weekend afternoon sessions often have BBQs.
detailedNotes.warnings: DIY spot — skate at your own risk, terrain changes frequently.
